item.title: Prior Distributions
item.description: Example: Let (theta) theta denote the probability of obtaining a head in a coin toss, and assume it is known the coin is either fair (has a head side and a tail side, and each is expected to be observed with similar frequency over many, many trials) or unfair in that it has a head on each side. The possible values of theta are theta = 1/2 and theta = 1
